content.description:
This fun slab problem climbs a perfectly flat face that appears almost featureless. The line lies in a narrow corridor above an angled landing- be careful! 

  Start standing on a right hand crimp and pinch some small crystals with the left. Move up and into a large, slopey pocket. Continue on small crimps that are difficult to see from below.
content.protection: Several pads and spotters. The top is quite high and the landing is angled. The rock immediately behind the problem doesn't help, but you won't hit it.
content.location: Located on the same boulder as Classic Arete. Rock hop down and to the right as you enter the Entrance Area. On the left, there will be a narrow corridor with a nice slab on the left side of it. Climb this.

content.description: Hard to find.  Start left hand on the arete and right on the undercling edge.  Move into the undercling jug and fire for the slopey lip, then match and make another big move for a huge crystal.
content.location: Near the entrance boulders, make a left and move down into a rocky outcropping.  Sombe is the face just begging to be climbed.

content.description: Start matched on an obvious crimp on the left side of the boulder.  Move up using holds on either side of the bulge feature and top out.  I assume the crack and boulder on the left are off.  A tricky but really nice problem with many beta options and fun movement.
content.location: Just left of Entrance Arete on the same boulder

content.description: Tackles the juggy right arete of the overhanging Entrance Boulder. The original start jug was broken off in 2007, making the V0 much harder. Sit start matched on the chalked edge in the center of the face where the jug once was. Pull one hard move out right to a corner, then move up to a good flat jug. Follow shelf-like jugs up the arete to top out. Great warmup.
content.location: The first boulder of climbable size that you reach from the car. Obvious problem on the right hand side.

content.description: Sit/squat start with left hand sidepull and a right hand crimp. Work right to arête, then up.
content.location: On boulder below warm ups facing north.

content.description:
This problem, while not physically very difficult, requires a good deal of trickery and beta. Fire away! 

  Start standing on the arête with a left hand sidepull/undercling and a right hand in a thin horizontal. Smear and move left around the corner, grabbing a poor right handhold on the little shelf. Readjust feet, and move up left into a juggy pod. Top out onto the tricky bulge. 

  Climbs far better than it looks; classic!
content.location: Just past the Entrance Boulder in a narrow corridor. The problem follows a short, blunt arête right on the trail.

content.description: The Entrance Area is the first series of outcrops that you come to when walking up the AT from parking. It has the most dense concentration of problems, and hosts most of Whiskey's best moderates. It's largest rock is a fine place to enjoy a view or have lunch.
